title.narrative: UN Capital Development Fund Core Contribution 2016

description.narrative: The United Nations Capital Development Fund (UNCDF) is the United Nation’s capital investment agency for the world’s 48 least developed countries. It creates new opportunities for poor people and their communities by increasing access to microfinance and investment capital. UNCDF focuses on Africa and the poorest countries of Asia, with a special commitment to countries emerging from conflict or crisis. It provides seed capital – grants and loans – and technical support to help microfinance institutions reach more poor households and small businesses, and local governments finance the capital investments, such as water systems, feeder roads, schools, irrigation schemes, that will improve poor people's lives. Funding under this investment represents Australia's 2016 core contribution to the Fund valued at $1.0 million to be expensed during the 2015-16 financial year.

participating-org.narrative: Australia - Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade

organisation.narrative: Australia - Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade

description.narrative: Expenses incurred during the financial year 2015/16 for Investments with a start date on or after 1 July 2008
